Package model

Class BusinessFacade

java.lang.Object
model.BusinessFacade
public class BusinessFacade
extends java.lang.Object
Class tasked with managing the access to the business logic, also manages DAO access

  • Field Summary

    DAO for configuration related operations

  • Method Details

    • updatePlaylists

      private boolean updatePlaylists()
      Updates the saved playlists for the current logged user
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • updateConfig

      private boolean updateConfig()
      Updates the saved configuration for the current logged user
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • getConfig

      private Config getConfig()
      Returns the saved configuration
      Returns:
      Saved configuration of the logged user

    • getSong

      public Song getSong​(Song s)
      Fills the given song with notes
      Parameters:
      s - Song to fill
      Returns:
      The input song filled with notes, if it was valid

    • getPlaylists

      public java.util.ArrayList<List> getPlaylists()
      Returns the playlists of the logged user
      Returns:
      The saved playlists, it tries to update them if they are null

    • getPlaylist

      public List getPlaylist​(java.lang.String list)
      Given a name of a playlist returns the matching playlist of the user, /!\ the songs in the playlist are filled with notes
      Parameters:
      list - Name of the playlist
      Returns:
      List of songs (filled with notes)

    • getBasicPlaylist

      public List getBasicPlaylist​(java.lang.String list)
      Given a name of a playlist returns the matching playlist of the user, without notes
      Parameters:
      list - Name of the list
      Returns:
      List of songs (without notes)

    • getLoggedUser

      public User getLoggedUser()
      Returns the logged user
      Returns:
      The user that logged it

    • getSongs

      public java.util.ArrayList<Song> getSongs()
      Obtains every song the user should be able to see, /!\ The songs don't have notes in them
      Returns:
      Visible notes for the logged user

      public boolean addSong​(Song song)
      Adds a song created by the logged user
      Parameters:
      song - Song to add
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • addDownloadedSong

      public boolean addDownloadedSong​(Song song)

      Parameters:
      song - Song to add
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • deleteSong

      public boolean deleteSong​(Song song)
      Deletes a song if it's author is the logged user
      Parameters:
      song - Song to eliminate
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

      public boolean existsSong​(Song song)
      Checks if a song exists in the database
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      True if the song exists

      public boolean addUser​(java.lang.String nick, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Adds a new user to the database
      Parameters:
      nick - Name of the user
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      Returns:
      True if the user could be created

    • deleteLoggedUser

      public boolean deleteLoggedUser​(java.lang.String password)
      Tries to delete the logged user with the given password
      Parameters:
      password - Password the user input
      Returns:
      True if the password was correct and the user could be deleted

    • login

      public boolean login​(java.lang.String nick, java.lang.String password)
      Tries to obtain the specified user and saves it (if it exists)
      Parameters:
      nick - Username or email of the user
      password - Password the user tried to log in with
      Returns:
      True if the (name/email - password) combination matched a user

      playlist - Playlist the song should be in
      Returns:
      True if the song exists in the specified playlist

    • addPlay

      public boolean addPlay​(int secondsPlayed, Song song)
      Adds a play from the logged user to the specified song with the specified length
      Parameters:
      secondsPlayed - Seconds the sog was played for
      song - Song the user played
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • removeSongPlaylist

      public boolean removeSongPlaylist​(java.lang.String playlist, Song song)
      Removes a song from a playlist created by the logged user
      Parameters:
      playlist - Playlist to remove the song from
      song - Song to remove from the playlist
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • getBinds

      public char[] getBinds()
      Returns the note binds configuration for the logged user
      Returns:
      A character array of the bindings of the notes, from lowest to highest

    • setKeyBinder

      public boolean setKeyBinder​(Note key, byte octava, char newBind)
      Saves a new note bind configuration for the logged user in the database
      Parameters:
      key - Note to change the bind of
      octava - Octave of the note
      newBind - New character the note should be associated with
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • setVolumePiano

      public boolean setVolumePiano​(float volume)
      Saves a new piano volume for the logged user
      Parameters:
      volume - New piano volume (0 = silent, 1 = max volume)
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • setVolumeSong

      public boolean setVolumeSong​(float volume)
      Saves a new song player volume for the logged user
      Parameters:
      volume - New song player volume (0 = silent, 1 = max volume)
      Returns:
      True if the operation was successful

    • getSongStatistics

      public int[] getSongStatistics()
      Returns data necessary to create "plays" statistics
      Returns:
      The data of how many song plays per hour exist in the last 24 hours, the last position is the current hour

    • getTimeStatistics

      public int[] getTimeStatistics()
      Returns data necessary to create "seconds listened" statistics
      Returns:
      The data of how many song plays per hour exist in the last 24 hours, the last position is the current hour

    • getTop5

      public Song[] getTop5​(int[] plays)
      Returns data necessary to create the "top 5 songs" table
      Parameters:
      plays - Array that will get filled up with the plays each song has, from most popular to least
      Returns:
      Top 5 most listened to songs in the database, ordered from most popular to least
